1.text: For behold, the Lord GOD of Hosts is about to remove from Jerusalem and Judah both supply and support: the whole supply of food and water,

2.text: the mighty man and the warrior, the judge and the prophet, the soothsayer and the elder,

3.text: the commander of fifty and the dignitary, the counselor, the cunning magician, and the clever enchanter.

4.text: “I will make mere lads their leaders, and children will rule over them.”

5.text: The people will oppress one another, man against man, neighbor against neighbor; the young will rise up against the old, and the base against the honorable.

6.text: A man will seize his brother within his father’s house: “You have a cloak—you be our leader! Take charge of this heap of rubble.”

7.text: On that day he will cry aloud: “I am not a healer. I have no food or clothing in my house. Do not make me leader of the people!”

8.text: For Jerusalem has stumbled and Judah has fallen because they spoke and acted against the LORD, defying His glorious presence.

9.text: The expression on their faces testifies against them, and like Sodom they flaunt their sin; they do not conceal it. Woe to them, for they have brought disaster upon themselves.

10.text: Tell the righteous it will be well with them, for they will enjoy the fruit of their labor.

11.text: Woe to the wicked; disaster is upon them! For they will be repaid with what their hands have done.

12.text: Youths oppress My people, and women rule over them. O My people, your guides mislead you; they turn you from your paths.

13.text: The LORD arises to contend; He stands to judge the people.

14.text: The LORD brings this charge against the elders and leaders of His people: “You have devoured the vineyard; the plunder of the poor is in your houses.

15.text: Why do you crush My people and grind the faces of the poor?” declares the Lord GOD of Hosts.

16.text: The LORD also says: “Because the daughters of Zion are haughty—walking with heads held high and wanton eyes, prancing and skipping as they go, jingling the bracelets on their ankles—

17.text: the Lord will bring sores on the heads of the daughters of Zion, and the LORD will make their foreheads bare.”

18.text: In that day the Lord will take away their finery: their anklets and headbands and crescents;

20.text: their headdresses, ankle chains, and sashes; their perfume bottles and charms;

21.text: their signet rings and nose rings;

22.text: their festive robes, capes, cloaks, and purses;

23.text: and their mirrors, linen garments, tiaras, and shawls.

24.text: Instead of fragrance there will be a stench; instead of a belt, a rope; instead of styled hair, baldness; instead of fine clothing, sackcloth; instead of beauty, shame.

25.text: Your men will fall by the sword, and your warriors in battle.

26.text: And the gates of Zion will lament and mourn; destitute, she will sit on the ground.
